div.a: The Secret Plot To Rescue Napoleon By Submarine

div.div: In 1820, one of Britain's most notorious criminals hatched a plan to rescue the emperor from exile on the Atlantic isle of St Helena -- but did he ever try it?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZmUmrB&via=Digg&text=The Secret Plot To Rescue Napoleon By Submarine

div.a: American Airlines' Calls For Innovative Pitches On Paper Napkins

div.div: The airline is asking customers for their business ideas and offering the chance to win domestic air travel.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHlG2y&via=Digg&text=American Airlines' Calls For Innovative Pitches On Paper Napkins

div.a: I Watched 'Oz The Great And Powerful' While Listening To 'Dark Side Of The Moon'

div.div: Watching Sam Raimi’s new movie while listening to Pink Floyd.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0eOgP&via=Digg&text=I Watched 'Oz The Great And Powerful' While Listening To 'Dark Side Of The Moon'

div.a: EA Turns Off SimCity's Fastest Gameplay Mode As It Struggles With Servers

div.div: About three and a half hours after cutting some "non-critical" gameplay features from SimCity in an attempt to get the online-only game back on its feet, Electronic Arts announced it would be turning off one of the more basic functions of the game: cheetah speed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XVaakV&via=Digg&text=EA Turns Off SimCity's Fastest Gameplay Mode As It Struggles With Servers

div.a: Style Icons Meet Their Food Equivalents

div.div: It all started when I saw a beetroot salad Caprese and thought how much it reminded me of my favourite photograph of Frida Kahlo. So voilà, I hope you enjoy my little food & style matches.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zg46E5&via=Digg&text=Style Icons Meet Their Food Equivalents

div.a: The Diary Of A Syrian Kidnapping Victim

div.div: NBC News’s Richard Engel was dispatched to cover Syria’s civil war last December when he lived every war correspondent’s nightmare: he and his crew were dragged from their car at gunpoint, blindfolded, gagged, and held captive by the shabiha militia.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YAVAhE&via=Digg&text=The Diary Of A Syrian Kidnapping Victim

div.a: South By Southwest Isn't A Kingmaker Anymore

div.div: “The secret's out.” How SXSWi morphed from a tech insider cabal to a party week for startup spring breakers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12zPhjT&via=Digg&text=South By Southwest Isn't A Kingmaker Anymore

div.a: A Photographic Guide To The World's Embalmed Leaders

div.div: When Hugo Chavez’s embalmed body is laid in a glass casket sometime next week, he will join at least eight other world leaders whose remains are on display for all eternity … or at least for as long as their keepers can preserve them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZmJ2vC&via=Digg&text=A Photographic Guide To The World's Embalmed Leaders

div.a: If Video Game Characters Had Sex

div.div: It's exactly what you think it is. And it's hysterical.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VBnewo&via=Digg&text=If Video Game Characters Had Sex

div.a: The Glass-Ceiling Index

div.div: Where is best to be a working woman in the rich world?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZgIEyH&via=Digg&text=The Glass-Ceiling Index

div.a: A Police Chief Is Using Polygraphs To Screen For Racist Applicants

div.div: A police chief hired to rebuild a tiny Tennessee department dismantled by scandal is using a lie-detector test to keep racists off his force.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZlAS6N&via=Digg&text=A Police Chief Is Using Polygraphs To Screen For Racist Applicants

div.div: FIRST THEY COME FOR THE BOOKS...

div.a: Why Is It Wrong To Burn Books?

div.div: Burning books is a sacrilegious act, and the taboo against it particularly binds writers. So what was I doing in a Somerset field lighting a match under the 32 volumes of the Encyclopædia Britannica?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13EKIE5&via=Digg&text=Why Is It Wrong To Burn Books?

div.div: AND IT THINKS THOSE SHOES ARE OVER

div.a: Google Glass App Identifies You By Your Fashion Sense

div.div: Can't find a face in the crowd? Not to worry, a human recognition system can spot people for you – even when their faces aren't visible. Designed for Google's forthcoming Glass headset, it recognises people by the clothes they are wearing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13Igd01&via=Digg&text=Google Glass App Identifies You By Your Fashion Sense

div.a: The Inside Story Of How 382 Recruiters Pursued An Imaginary Engineer

div.div: Wherry created a false persona, Pete London, whose stacked resume was really based on Wherry’s own experiences. With a one-page website and a WordPress blog with a few JavaScript references, Pete London came to life on the web.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13HPaC9&via=Digg&text=The Inside Story Of How 382 Recruiters Pursued An Imaginary Engineer

div.div: THE ORIGINAL RODENT OF UNUSUAL SIZE

div.a: The History Of Scabby The Rat

div.div: You've seen him before. But where did he get his start?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zx0wDz&via=Digg&text=The History Of Scabby The Rat

div.a: The Case For Big Brother

div.div: A little government monitoring can be a good thing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XOxOzC&via=Digg&text=The Case For Big Brother

div.a: National Geographic Celebrates 125 Years Of Photography With New Tumblr

div.div: The Tumblr, titled Found, was launched in celebration of the magazine's 125th anniversary, and although their initiative still young, National Geographic's archivists have already published some remarkably beautiful images.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15BC3Rx&via=Digg&text=National Geographic Celebrates 125 Years Of Photography With New Tumblr

div.div: RIVALS OF KOOL AND THE GANG

div.a: FBI Reveals Why It Labeled Insane Clown Posse Gang Leaders

div.div: The Bureau attempted to pinpoint ‘racketeering activity’ among Juggalo Family.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZiLIXR&via=Digg&text=FBI Reveals Why It Labeled Insane Clown Posse Gang Leaders

div.a: Scientists May Have Found New Life Under Antarctic Ice

div.div: Russian scientists believe they have discovered new life forms sealed off for millions of years in a subglacial lake deep under the Antarctic ice.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z2luKq&via=Digg&text=Scientists May Have Found New Life Under Antarctic Ice

div.a: Pixar's 22 Rules Of Storytelling

div.div: These rules were originally tweeted by Emma Coates, Pixar’s Story Artist. Number 9 on the list - When you’re stuck, make a list of what wouldn’t happen next – is a great one and can apply to writers in all genres.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14xsXmf&via=Digg&text=Pixar's 22 Rules Of Storytelling

div.div: HE SAYS 'HATSUNE MIKU' AN AWFUL LOT

div.a: I Can't Stop Watching This Hilariously Stilted Japanese Domino's Ad

div.div: Here's Domino's Pizza Japan president Scott Oellkers introducing a new Domino's pizza iPhone app. What is it about this? The jump cuts? The closeups of Oellkers' eyeballs? Oellkers' own natural showmanship? The little flourish he does at the end?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10gIF4H&via=Digg&text=I Can't Stop Watching This Hilariously Stilted Japanese Domino's Ad

div.div: BECAUSE TEACHERS NEVER HAVE A BAD DAY

div.a: South Dakota Is First State To Legalize Teachers With Guns Post-Newtown

div.div: South Dakota Gov. Dennis Daugaard has signed the first post-Newtown law to allow teachers to carry guns in school.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wausq5&via=Digg&text=South Dakota Is First State To Legalize Teachers With Guns Post-Newtown

div.div: OR WHY YOU'RE NOT AT SXSW

div.a: Canceled Flights, Canceled Storm: Why Don't Planes Fly In Good Weather?

div.div: As yet another winter storm rambled across the US this week, a time-honored tradition set in: hundreds of flight cancellations struck travelers in a coordinated wave just ahead of the storm. But when the storm fizzles out, why aren't the flights reinstated?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15C57Z5&via=Digg&text=Canceled Flights, Canceled Storm: Why Don't Planes Fly In Good Weather?

div.a: Why Americans—And Everyone Else—Will Want Drones In The Skies

div.div: Although privacy advocates worry about the use of unmanned aircraft, fearing they will be deployed to spy on Americans, some uses and applications could make drones invaluable.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12zd1ol&via=Digg&text=Why Americans—And Everyone Else—Will Want Drones In The Skies

div.a: 7 Knives You Will Legally Be Able To Take On A Plane

div.div: Awwww yeah, those suckers at the TSA are going to let us take knives on planes again. Pocket knives are the best. Get one. Here are some suggestions—all plane-legal as of April 25th.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZlP8fT&via=Digg&text=7 Knives You Will Legally Be Able To Take On A Plane

div.div: IT DEPENDS. WHO'S GOT THE BETTER LAWYER?

div.a: If A Driverless Car Crashes, Who's Liable?

div.div: Some number of years from now, the technology may exist for cars to drive themselves. But getting the technology right won't be enough. Governments and courts will have to figure out lots of new legal and regulatory issues. One key question: If a driverless car crashes, who's liable?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZkWQqz&via=Digg&text=If A Driverless Car Crashes, Who's Liable?

div.a: Anthropologists Uncover All the Ways We’ve Wiped

div.div: An analysis of old customs makes us privy to a slice of ancient life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wegg1L&via=Digg&text=Anthropologists Uncover All the Ways We’ve Wiped
